title: Suggestions for next weeks' Type Battle?
content: Shout out your suggestions for next weeks' Typophile Type Battle.
author: Joe Pemberton

comments.content: Redesign of the Coca Cola logo for the 21st century, only if its legal to touch of course.

This is probably way too obscure but I think would be a challenging battle:  
Take Georgia (or any font with an /f/ with a standard ball terminal) and redesign the top of f so that if a dotless i follows it can not be mistaken for /fi/.

I like the ligature suggestion.  
Another one could be, given some definite letters, choose a well known typeface which is tied with a particular style and make them in another style.  
Examples: Franklin Serif, Garamond Sans, Eurostile Slab, etc.

Another one: reinvent/improve the @'s design.  
(see [http://www.typophile.com/node/65886](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013103607/http:/www.typophile.com/node/65886 "http://www.typophile.com/node/65886"))

Or, expand the asterisk to at least five symbols.  
(see [http://www.typophile.com/node/65861](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013103607/http:/www.typophile.com/node/65861 "http://www.typophile.com/node/65861"))
I'd love to see what everyone can do with the Coca Cola logo!

In a given typeface (say, Times New Roman or Myriad), invent new forms of letters so that the letters presently more-or-less indistinguishable in upper- and lowecase (CSVXZ) have distinct case forms.  
 (That came from [http://www.typophile.com/node/33647](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013103607/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33647))

How about numerals for Barf Bold by B. “Hap” Kliban?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013103607im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Barf_bold_4289.png)
  
No, I'm not serious.
@eliason: your suggestions are always on the verge of typographic subtlety! :-)

Another one:  
after the "album cover meme" (one of my favorites), and the "book cover meme", I think we could have the "movie poster meme"!
Now that it's been a year and a half, how about a new type battle? :-)

Since the last one listed on [http://typophile.com/typebattles](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013103607/http:/typophile.com/typebattles "http://typophile.com/typebattles") is still the Digg one,  
I don’t think it’s a priority. Maybe we should make them ourselves ;-)

Here's an idea: redesign Schadow's superyucky numerals.  
See comments here: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/kupfers/5819488164/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013103607/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/kupfers/5819488164/ "http://www.flickr.com/photos/kupfers/5819488164/")
